36.verse: Surely I would carry it upon my shoulder, and bind it to me like atarot (crowns).

37.verse: I would declare unto Him the number of my steps; like a nagid (prince) would I go near unto Him.

38.verse: If my adamah cry against me, or if the furrows had wept together,

39.verse: If I have eaten the yield thereof without kesef (payment), or have broken the nefesh of the tenants thereof,

40.verse: Let thistles grow instead of chittim (wheat), and weed instead of barley. The divrei Iyov are ended.

1.verse: So these shloshet ha’anashim ceased to answer Iyov, because he was tzaddik in his eyes.

2.verse: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu ben Barachel the Buzi, of the mishpochah Ram; against Iyov was his wrath kindled, because Iyov justified his nefesh rather than Elohim.

3.verse: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no ma’aneh (refutation, answer), and yet had condemned Iyov.

4.verse: Now Elihu had waited till Iyov had spoken, because they were elder than he.

5.verse: When Elihu saw that there was no ma’aneh in the mouth of these shloshet ha’anashim, then his wrath was kindled.

6.verse: And Elihu ben Barachel the Buzi answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and dared not tell you of what I have da’as.

7.verse: I said, Yamim should speak, and multitude of shanim should teach chochmah.

8.verse: But there is a ruach in enosh, and the neshamat Shaddai giveth them binah.

9.verse: Great men are not always wise, neither do the zekenim understand mishpat.

10.verse: Therefore I said, Pay heed to me; I also will tell of what I have da’as.

11.verse: Hen (behold), I waited for your dvarim; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.

12.verse: Yea, I attended unto you, and, hinei, there was none of you that proved Iyov wrong, or that answered his words.

13.verse: Yet do not say, We have found chochmah; El may vanquish him, lo ish (not man).

14.verse: Now he hath not directed his millin (words) against me; neither will I answer him with your speeches.

15.verse: They were amazed; they answered no od (more); they left off speaking.

16.verse: When I had waited, (for they spoke not, but stood still, and answered no od [more]);

17.verse: I said, I will answer also my chelek (portion); I also will show of mine da’as.

18.verse: For I am full of millim (words), the ruach within me compelleth me.

19.verse: Hinei, my beten is like yayin which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like ovot chadashim (new wineskins).

20.verse: I will speak that I may be relieved; I will open my sfatayim and answer.

21.verse: Let me not, now, show any man partiality, neither let me flatter adam.

22.verse: For I am not skilled in flattery; in so doing Oseini (my Maker) would soon take me away.

1.verse: Wherefore, Iyov, now, hear my speeches, and pay heed to all my words.

2.verse: Hinei, now I have opened my mouth, my leshon hath spoken in my mouth.

3.verse: My words shall be of my yosher lev (the uprightness of my heart), and my lips shall utter da’as that is pure.

4.verse: The Ruach El [Ruach Hakodesh] hath made me, and the Neshamah of Shaddai hath given me life.

5.verse: Im (If) thou canst, answer me; set thy words in order in my presence; take thy stand.

6.verse: See, I am like thee, of El, from chomer (clay) was I taken also.

7.verse: Hinei, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my pressure be heavy upon thee.

8.verse: Surely thou hast spoken in my ozen, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

9.verse: I am pure without peysha; I am clean; neither is there avon in me [Yn 8:46].

10.verse: Yet He findeth tenuot (occasions) against me, He counteth me for his oyev,

11.verse: He putteth my raglayim in the stocks, He watcheth all my orkhot.

12.verse: But in this thou art not right; I will answer thee, that Eloah is greater than enosh.

13.verse: Why dost thou contend against Him? For He giveth not account of any of His matters.

14.verse: For El speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.

15.verse: In a chalom, in a chezyon lailah, when deep sleep falleth upon anashim, in slumberings upon the mishkav (bed),

16.verse: Then He openeth the ozen anashim, and sealeth their admonition

17.verse: That He may turn them aside from their deeds, and hide pride from gever (man).

18.verse: He keepeth back his nefesh from the shachat, and his life from the overthrow of the sword.

19.verse: He is chastened also with pain upon his mishkav, and the continual strife in his atzmot;

20.verse: So that his life abhorreth lechem, and his nefesh dainty food.

21.verse: His basar is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his atzmot that were not seen stick out.

22.verse: Yea, his nefesh draweth near unto the shachat, and his life to the ones bringing death.

23.verse: If there be a malach (messenger, i.e., Malach HaBrit, HaAdon [see Malachi 3:1] ) as melitz (mediator) for him, one of a thousand, who declares a person yashar (upright, Isa 53:11),

24.verse: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the shachat (pit); I have found a kofer (ransom) [Mk 10:45].

25.verse: His basar shall be restored like a na’ar; he shall return to the yamim of his youthful vigor;

26.verse: He shall pray unto Eloah, and be accepted by Him, and he shall see His face with teruah (shouts of joy); thus He recompenseth unto enosh his tzedek.

27.verse: He looketh upon anashim, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was yashar, and it was not recompensed to me,

28.verse: He will redeem his nefesh from going into the shachat, and his life shall see the ohr.

29.verse: Lo, all these things worketh El, twice, shalosh with gever (man)

30.verse: To bring back his nefesh from the shachat (pit), to be enlightened with the Ohr HaChayyim (light of the living).

31.verse: Mark well, O Iyov, pay heed unto me; hold thy peace, and I will speak.

32.verse: If thou hast anything to say, answer me; dabbir (speak), for I desire to justify thee.

33.verse: If not, pay heed unto me; hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee chochmah.

1.verse: Furthermore Elihu answered and said,

2.verse: Hear my words, O ye chachamim; and give ear unto me, ye that have da’as.

3.verse: For the ozen trieth words, as the mouth tasteth food.

4.verse: Let us choose for ourselves what is mishpat (right); let us know among ourselves what is tov.

5.verse: For Iyov hath said, I am innocent; and El hath taken away my mishpat (right).

6.verse: I declare the mishpat (case) against me a lie; though without peysha, my arrow wound is incurable.

7.verse: What gever is like Iyov, who drinketh up the scorn [of his friends] like mayim?

8.verse: Who goeth in chaverah with the po’alei aven (workers of iniquity, evildoers), and walketh with anshei resha.

9.verse: For he hath said, It profiteth a gever nothing that he should please Elohim.

10.verse: Therefore pay heed unto me ye anashei levav (men of understanding); far be it from El, that He should do evil, and from Shaddai, that He should do wrong.

11.verse: For the po’al adam (work of a man) shall He repay unto him, and make every man to find according to the man’s ways.

12.verse: Yea, surely El will not do wickedly, neither will Shaddai pervert mishpat (justice).

13.verse: Who hath given Him right to rule the earth? Or who hath appointed Him over the tevel?

14.verse: If He should so determine, if He gather unto Himself His Ruach and His Neshamah,

15.verse: All basar would perish together, and adam would return unto aphar.

16.verse: If now thou hast binah, hear this: pay heed to the kol (voice) of my words.

17.verse: Shall even one that hateth mishpat (right) govern? And wilt thou condemn Him that is Tzaddik and Kabir (the Mighty One)?

18.verse: Is it fit to say to a melech, Thou art beli’ya’al? And to nobles, Ye are rasha.

19.verse: Who shows no partiality to sarim (princes), nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? For they all are the ma’aseh (work) of His hands.

20.verse: In a moment shall they die, and at chatzot lailah the people shall be shaken, and pass away, and the mighty shall be taken away without human hand.

21.verse: For His eyes are upon the darkhei ish and He seeth all his goings.

22.verse: There is no choshech, nor tzalmavet, where the po’alei aven (evildoers) may hide themselves.

23.verse: For He does not need to consider an ish further for anyone to go before El in mispat (judgment).

24.verse: He shall break in pieces kabirim (mighty men) without investigation, and sets acherim (others) in their place.

25.verse: Therefore He knoweth their works, and He overthroweth them in the lailah, so that they are crushed.

26.verse: He striketh them as resha’im in the open sight of others;

27.verse: Because they turned back from following Him, and would not regard any of His drakhim;

28.verse: So that they caused the cry of the poor to come unto Him, and He heareth the cry of the aniyim.

29.verse: When He giveth quietness, who then can condemn? When He hideth His panim, who then can behold Him? Whether it be a nation, or an individual only?

30.verse: That the chanef (hypocrite) reign not, nor those who ensnare the people.

31.verse: For has anyone said unto El, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more;

32.verse: Teach Thou me what I see not; im (if) I have done iniquity, I will do no more?

33.verse: Will He then recompense to suit you, just because you disavow it? Thou must choose, not I; therefore speak that of which thou hast da’as.

34.verse: Let anshei levav (men of understanding) say to me, and let a gever chacham who pays heed unto me say,

35.verse: Iyov hath spoken without da’as, and his words were without seichel.

36.verse: Iyov ought to be tried unto the limit, because his answers are those of anshei aven.

37.verse: For he addeth peysha unto his chattat, he clappeth his hands [shaking fist at G-d] among us, and multiplieth his words against El.

1.verse: Elihu spoke moreover, and said,

2.verse: Thinkest thou this to be mishpat (right, just), that thou saidst, Tzidki meEl (I am cleared, in the right, justified before G-d)?

3.verse: Ki (yet) thou saidst, What advantage will it be unto thee? and, What profit shall I have, more than if I had sinned [see 9:22]?

4.verse: I will answer thee, and thy companions with thee.

5.verse: Look unto Shomayim, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.

6.verse: If thou sinnest, what doest thou against Him? Or if thy peysha’im be multiplied, what doest thou unto Him?

7.verse: If thou be tzaddik (righteous), what givest thou Him? Or what receiveth He of thine yad?

8.verse: Thy resha (wickedness) may hurt an ish as thou art; and thy tzedek may profit the ben adam.

9.verse: They cry out under a load of oppression; they plead for relief from the zero’a of the rabbim.

10.verse: But none saith, Where is Eloah Osai (G-d my Maker), Who giveth zemirot balailah (songs in the night);

11.verse: Who teacheth us more than the behamot eretz, and maketh us wiser than the oph HaShomayim?

12.verse: There they cry out, but none giveth answer, because of the ga’on (pride, arrogance) of ra’im (wicked men).

13.verse: Surely El will not hear shav (vanity), neither will Shaddai regard it.

14.verse: Although thou sayest thou cannot see Him, yet Din (the court case) is before Him; therefore trust thou, waiting for Him,

15.verse: though ye say His anger does not pakad (visit, punish) anything and that He does not regard wickedness much;

16.verse: Therefore doth Iyov open his mouth hevel (in vain); he multiplieth words without da’as.

1.verse: Elihu also proceeded, and said,

2.verse: Bear with me a little, and I will show thee that I have yet to speak on behalf of Eloah.

3.verse: I will get my da’as from afar, and will ascribe tzedek to my Maker.

4.verse: For truly my words shall not be sheker; one that is tamim (complete) in da’as is among thee.

5.verse: See, El is kabir (mighty), and despiseth not any; He is kabir in ko’ach lev (strength of understanding).

6.verse: He preserveth not the life of the rasha, but giveth mishpat to the aniyim.

7.verse: He withdraweth not His eyes from the tzaddik, but with melachim are they on the kisse; yea, He doth establish them lanetzach (forever), and they are exalted.

8.verse: And if they be bound in chains, and be held fast in chevlei oni (cords of affliction),

9.verse: Then He showeth them their work, and their peysha’im that they have done arrogantly.

10.verse: He openeth also their ozen to musar (discipline), and commandeth that they make teshuvah and turn from evil.

11.verse: If they obey and serve Him, they shall spend their yamim in tov (prosperity), and their shanim in contentment.

12.verse: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without da’as.

13.verse: But the chanefei lev (irreligious in heart, hypocrites) incur wrath; they do not cry for help when He bindeth them.

14.verse: They die in youth, their nefesh among the kedeshim (cult male prostitutes, youthful lusts).

15.verse: He delivereth the oni in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.

16.verse: Even so would He have removed thee out of the tzar (distress) into a rachav (broad place), free from restriction, to the comfort of thy shulchan, full of choice food.

17.verse: But thou hast been fixated on the din of the rasha; din and mishpat take hold on thee.

18.verse: Because there is chemah, beware lest He take thee away with His stroke; then a rav kopher (great ransom) cannot deliver thee.

19.verse: Will He esteem thy riches? No, not zahav, nor all the forces of ko’ach.

20.verse: Desire not halailah (the night), when people are cut off in their place.

21.verse: Take heed, regard not iniquity; for this hast thou chosen rather than oni.

22.verse: See, El exalted by His ko’ach. Who is a moreh (teacher) like Him?

23.verse: Who hath enjoined Him His derech? Or who can say, Thou hast done wrong?

24.verse: Remember that thou must extol His work, of which anashim have sung praises.

25.verse: Kol adam has seen it; enosh beholds it afar off.

26.verse: See, El is great, and we know Him not, neither can the mispar of His shanim be searched out.

27.verse: For He draws up the drops of mayim; He distills His mist as matar;

28.verse: Which the clouds do drop and distill upon adam abundantly.

29.verse: Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the thunderings of His sukkah?

30.verse: See, He spreadeth His ohr upon it, and covereth the depths of the yam.

31.verse: For by them governeth He the amim (nations); He giveth okhel in abundance.

32.verse: His hands He covers with the ohr (lightning), and commandeth it to strike the mark.

33.verse: The thunder thereof showeth concerning Him; the storm tells His indignant af (wrath).

1.verse: At this also my lev trembleth, and is moved out of its place.

2.verse: Hear attentively the rogez of His voice, and the sound that goeth out of His mouth.

3.verse: He directeth it under kol HaShomayim, and His ohr (lightning) unto the ends of ha’aretz.

4.verse: After it His kol (voice) roareth; He thundereth with the kol of His majesty; one cannot hold them back when His kol is heard.

5.verse: El thundereth marvellously with His kol; gedolot doeth He, beyond our understanding.

6.verse: For He saith to the snow, Fall thou to the eretz; likewise to the geshem matar, the heavy downpour of rain.

7.verse: He sealeth up kol adam; that all men may know His work.

8.verse: Then the chayyah (beasts) go into their lair, and remain in their places.

9.verse: Out of its cheder (chamber) cometh the whirlwind; and cold out of the driving winds.

10.verse: By the neshamah of El frost is given, and the broad mayim are frozen.

11.verse: Also by watering He loadeth the thick cloud; He scattereth the anan of His ohr (lightning),

12.verse: And it is turned round about by His guidance; that they may do whatsoever He commandeth them upon the face of the tevel (habitable world).

13.verse: He causeth it to happen, whether for correction, or for His land, or for chesed.

14.verse: Pay heed unto this, O Iyov; stand still, and consider the nifle’ot El (wondrous works of G-d).

15.verse: Dost thou know how Elo’ah controls them, and caused the ohr (lightning) of His cloud to flash?

16.verse: Dost thou know the spreading out of the clouds, the wondrous works of Him which is tamim in da’as?

17.verse: You whose garments are hot, when the eretz is still because of the south wind,

18.verse: Hast thou with Him spread out the shekhakim (clouds), hard as a molten mirror?

19.verse: Teach us what we shall say unto Him, for we cannot order our case by reason of choshech.

20.verse: Should it be told Him that I wish to speak? Or should an ish say that he would be swallowed up?

21.verse: And now men cannot look at the bright ohr which is in the clouds, when the ruach passeth, and cleareth them.

22.verse: Splendor of zahav cometh out of the north; with Elo’ah is awesome hod (majesty).

23.verse: Touching Shaddai, we cannot reach Him; He is exalted in ko’ach, and in mishpat, and rov tzedakah; He does not oppress.

24.verse: Anashim do therefore fear Him; He regardeth not any that are wise of heart.

1.verse: Then Hashem answered Iyov out of the whirlwind, and said,

2.verse: Who is this that darkeneth etzah (counsel) with words without da’as?

3.verse: Gird up now thy loins like a gever; for I will ask of thee, and thou wilt answer Me.

4.verse: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of eretz? Tell, if thou hast binah.

5.verse: Who hath drafted the dimensions thereof, if thou hast da’as? Or who hath stretched a measuring line across it?

6.verse: Whereupon are the foundations thereof set? Or who laid the even-pinnah (cornerstone) thereof

7.verse: When the kokhvei boker sang together, and all the Bnei Elohim shouted for joy?

8.verse: Or who shut up the yam behind doors? Who brought it forth, issuing out of the rekhem (womb)

9.verse: When I made the anan the garment thereof, and thick darkness its swaddling band,

10.verse: And fixed bounds for it, and set bars and dlatot (doors),

11.verse: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further; and poh (here) shall thy proud waves be stopped?

12.verse: Hast thou commanded the boker since thy yamim began; or caused the shachar (dawn) to know its place;

13.verse: That it might seize the ends of ha’aretz, that the resha’im be shaken out of it?

14.verse: It is changed like chomer (clay) under the khotam (seal); and they stand out like a garment.

15.verse: And from the resha’im their ohr is denied, and the upraised zero’a shall be broken.

16.verse: Hast thou entered into the springs of the yam? Or hast thou walked in the recesses of the tehom?

17.verse: Have the sha’arei mavet been disclosed unto thee? Or hast thou seen the sha’arei tzalmavet?

18.verse: Hast thou perceived the expanse of eretz? Tell Me if thou hast da’as of it all.

19.verse: Where is the derech where ohr dwelleth? And as for choshech, where is the place thereof,

20.verse: That thou shouldest take it to its border, and that thou shouldest have da’as of the paths to its bais?

21.verse: Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? Or because the mispar of thy yamim is so great?

22.verse: Hast thou entered into the otzrot (storehouses) of the snow? Or hast thou seen the otzrot of barad (hail),

23.verse: Which I have reserved for the time of tzar, for the yom kerav (battle) and milchamah (war)?

24.verse: Which is the derech where the ohr is distributed, where is scattered the east wind upon eretz?

25.verse: Who hath cut a channel for the overflowing of waters, or a derech for the lightning of thunder,

26.verse: To cause it to rain on eretz, where lo ish is; on midbar, wherein there is lo adam;

27.verse: To saturate a desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the desheh to spring forth?

28.verse: Hath the rain an av? Or who hath begotten the drops of tal (dew)?

29.verse: Out of whose beten cometh the ice? And the frost of Shomayim, who giveth birth to it?

30.verse: The mayim harden like even (stone), and the face of tehom is frozen.

31.verse: Canst thou bind the chains of the Pleiades, or loose the bonds of Orion?

32.verse: Canst thou bring forth Mazzarot in their times? Or canst thou guide the Bear with its banim?

33.verse: Knowest thou the chukkot of Shomayim? Canst thou set the rule over ha’aretz?

34.verse: Canst thou lift up thy kol (voice) to the clouds, that abundance of mayim may cover thee?

35.verse: Canst thou send lightning bolts, that they may go and say unto thee, Hineinu (here we are)?

36.verse: Who hath put chochmah in the inward parts, or who hath given binah to the mind?

37.verse: Who can number the clouds in chochmah, or who can tip the waterskins of Shomayim,

38.verse: When the dust hardens into a clump, and the clods cleave fast together?

39.verse: Wilt thou hunt the teref for the lioness, or fill the appetite of her whelps,

40.verse: When they crouch in their me’onot (dens), and abide in the lair to lie in ambush?

41.verse: Who provideth for the raven his food? When his young ones cry unto El, they wander about for lack of okhel.

1.verse: Dost thou have da’as of the et (time) when the mountain goats give birth, or art thou shomer to watch when the doe bears her fawn?

2.verse: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil, or dost thou have da’as of the et (time) when they give birth?

3.verse: They crouch down, they bring forth their yeledim, their chavalim (birth pains) are cast off in riddance.

4.verse: Their banim gain strength, they grow up in the bar (open, wild); they go forth, and return not unto them.

5.verse: Who hath sent out the pere (wild donkey) free, or who hath untied the ropes of the arod (wild donkey, onager),

6.verse: Whose bais I have made the aravah, and the barren land his mishkenot (dwellings)?

7.verse: He laughs at the tumult of the kiryah (city), neither regardeth he the shouts of the driver.

8.verse: The range of the harim is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

9.verse: Will the wild ox be willing to be thy eved, or stay the night by thy evus (animal feeding trough)?

10.verse: Canst thou bind the wild ox to the furrow with a rope, or will it behind thee till the amakim (valleys)?

11.verse: Wilt thou depend on him, because his ko’ach is great, or wilt thou hand over thy heavy work to him?

12.verse: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring in thy zera (grain), and gather it into thy goren (threshing floor)?

13.verse: Joyfully flapping are the wings of the ostrich, but are her wings and feathers like the khasidah (stork)?

14.verse: For the ostrich layeth her betzim (eggs) la’aretz (on the ground), and warmeth them in the sand,

15.verse: And forgetteth that the regel may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.

16.verse: She treats harshly her banim, as though they were not hers; though her labor should be in vain, yet she is without pachad (fear, care),

17.verse: Because Elo’ah hath deprived her of chochmah, neither hath he imparted to her binah.

18.verse: Yet at the et (time) she flaps her wings [to run], she laughs at the sus and his rider.

19.verse: Hast thou given the sus gevurah? Hast thou clothed his neck with a flowing mane?

20.verse: Canst thou make him leap like an arbeh (locust)? The hod (glory) of his snorting strikes terror.

21.verse: He paweth in the emek (valley), and rejoiceth in his koach; he chargeth into the fray.

22.verse: He laugheth at pachad, and nothing fears; neither turneth he back from the cherev.

23.verse: The quiver rattleth at his side, the glittering spear and the kidon (scimitar, curved sword).

24.verse: He eats up the eretz with fierceness and rogez (rage); neither standeth he still at the sound of the shofar.

25.verse: As often as the shofar, he snorts Aha! and he smelleth the milchamah afar off, the shout of the sarim, and the teru’ah (battle cry).

26.verse: Doth the hawk fly by thy binah, and stretch her wings toward the south?

27.verse: Doth the nesher (eagle) mount up at thy command, and make her ken (nest) on high?

28.verse: She dwelleth and abideth on the cliff, upon the crag of the rock, its metzudah (stronghold).

29.verse: From there she seeketh the okhel (food, prey), and her eyes behold it from afar off.

30.verse: Her young ones feast on dahm; and where the chalalim (slain ones) are, there it is.

1.verse: Moreover Hashem answered Iyov, and said,

2.verse: Shall he that contendeth with Shaddai correct him? The mokhiach Eloah (rebuker of G-d), let him answer it.

3.verse: Then Iyov answered Hashem, and said,

4.verse: See, I am vile; what shall I answer Thee? I will lay mine yad upon my mouth.

5.verse: Once have I spoken, but I will not answer; yea, shtayim (twice), but I will proceed no further.

6.verse: Then answered Hashem unto Iyov out of the whirlwind, and said,

7.verse: Gird up thy loins now like a gever. I will question thee, and thou shall answer Me.

8.verse: Wilt thou also annul My mishpat (justice)? Wilt thou condemn Me, that thou mayest be justified?

9.verse: Hast thou a zero’a like El? Or canst thou thunder with a kol (voice) like Him?

10.verse: Adorn thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with hod (glory) and hadar (splendor).

11.verse: Unleash thy evrot af (furious wrath); and behold every one that is proud, and bring him low.

12.verse: Look on every one that is proud, and humble him, and tread down the resha’im in their place.

13.verse: Bury them in the aphar together; shroud their faces in the crypt.

14.verse: Then odecha (will I confess, admit unto thee) that thine own right hand can save thee.

15.verse: Hinei now behemot (hippopotamus), which I made along with thee; he eateth grass like an ox.

16.verse: Hinei now, his koach is in his loins, and his force is in the sinews of his beten (belly).

17.verse: He moveth his zanav (tail) like a cedar branch; the sinews of his thighs are firmly interwoven.

18.verse: His atzmot are like tubes of nechoshet; his limbs are like rods of barzel (iron).

19.verse: He is the reshit (firstling) of the ways of El; He, his Maker, can approach it with His cherev.

20.verse: Surely the harim bring forth food for him, where all the wild beasts play.

21.verse: He lieth under the shade of lotus plants, beseter (in the covert) of the reed and marsh.

22.verse: The lotus plants cover him with their shadow; the willows by the nakhal (brook, stream) surround him.

23.verse: See, when the nahar (river) rages, he is not alarmed; he is confident, though Yarden breaketh forth upon his mouth.

24.verse: While he is looking can one capture him? With mokeshim (hooks) can one pierce his nose?

1.verse: Canst thou draw out Leviathan with a khakah (fishhook)? Or tie down his leshon with a cord?

2.verse: Canst thou put a hook into his af (nose)? Or bore his jaw through with a barb?

3.verse: Will he make many tachanunim unto thee? Will he speak soft words unto thee?

4.verse: Will he make a brit (covenant) with thee? Wilt thou take him for an eved olam?

5.verse: Wilt thou play with him as with a pet bird? Or wilt thou leash him for thy na’arot (maidens)?

6.verse: Shall traders barter for him? Shall they divide him among the Kena’anim (Canaanites, merchants)?

7.verse: Canst thou fill his ohr (skin) with harpoons? Or his head with fishing spears?

8.verse: Lay thine hand upon him; remember the milchamah. Thou wilt not do it more.

9.verse: See, every tokhelet (expectation) is false; shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

10.verse: None is so foolhardy that dare stir him up. Mi (who) then is able to stand before Me?

11.verse: Mi (who) hath given Me, that I must repay him? Whatsoever is under the kol HaShomayim is Mine.

12.verse: I will not keep silent about his members, nor his gevurah, nor the grace of his form.

13.verse: Mi (who) can remove his outer garment? Or mi (who) can come near him with a double bridle?

14.verse: Mi (who) can open the doors of his face? Terror is round about his teeth.

15.verse: His scales are his ga’avah (pride), shut up together as with a rigid chotam (seal).

16.verse: One is so near to another, that no ruach (air) can pass between them.

17.verse: They are joined one to another; they stick together, inseparably.

18.verse: By his sneezings ohr flares out, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the shachar.

19.verse: Out of his mouth goeth flame, and sparks of eish leap out.

20.verse: Out of his nostrils goeth forth smoke, like a seething pot or caldron.

21.verse: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

22.verse: In his neck resideth oz (strength), and terror dances before him.

23.verse: The flanks of his basar are joined together; they are firm in themselves, immoveable.

24.verse: His lev (chest) is as firm as an even (stone); yea, as hard as the lower millstone.

25.verse: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid; shuddering they retreat.

26.verse: The cherev of him that reacheth at him cannot hold—the spear, the dart, nor the harpoon.

27.verse: He esteemeth barzel (iron) like straw, and nechoshet as rotten wood.

28.verse: The arrow cannot make him flee; sling stones are turned with him into stubble.

29.verse: Clubs are counted as straw; he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

30.verse: Sharp shards are his under parts; he leaveth a trail in the mud like a threshing sledge.

31.verse: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot; he stirreth the yam like a pot of ointment.

32.verse: He maketh a wake to shine after him; one would think the deep to be white hair.

33.verse: Upon earth there is not his equal, who is created without fear.

34.verse: He beholdeth all things lofty; he is a melech over every proud beast.

1.verse: Then Iyov answered Hashem, and said,

2.verse: I have da’as that Thou canst do all things, and that no purpose of Thine can be thwarted.

3.verse: Who is this that hideth etzah (counsel) without da’as? Therefore have I judged without understanding things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.

4.verse: Shema, I beseech Thee, and I will speak; I will ask of Thee, and declare Thou unto me.

5.verse: I have heard of Thee by the hearing of the ozen, but now mine eye hath seen Thee.

6.verse: Therefore I abhor myself, and nichamti (I am sorry, I make teshuvah) in dust and ashes.

7.verse: And it was so, that after Hashem had spoken these words unto Iyov, Hashem said to Eliphaz the Temani, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends; for ye have not spoken in reference to Me the thing that is nekhonah (correct), like Avdi Iyov hath.

8.verse: Therefore take unto you now seven bulls and seven rams, and go to Avdi Iyov, and offer up for yourselves olah (burnt offering); and Avdi Iyov shall pray for you; for him will I accept; lest I deal with you after your nevalah (folly), in that ye have not spoken in reference to Me the thing which is nekhonah (correct), like Avdi Iyov.

9.verse: So Eliphaz the Temani and Bildad the Shuchi and Tzophar the Na’amati went, and did according as Hashem commanded them. Hashem also accepted Iyov.

10.verse: And Hashem restored the fortunes of Iyov, when he prayed for his friends; also Hashem gave Iyov twice as much as he possessed before.

11.verse: Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat lechem with him in his bais; and they expressed sympathy with him, and comforted him over all the ra’ah that Hashem had brought upon him; every ish also gave him a kesitah, and every ish a ring of zahav.

12.verse: So Hashem blessed the acharit (latter end) of Iyov more than his reshit; for he had fourteen thousand tzon, and six thousand gemalim, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she-donkeys.

13.verse: He had also seven banim and shalosh banot.

14.verse: And he called the shem of the first, Yemima, and the shem of the second, Ketziah, and the shem of the third, Keren-hapuch.

15.verse: And in kol ha’aretz were no nashim found so fair as the banot Iyov; and their av gave them nachalah with their achim.

16.verse: After this lived Iyov an hundred and forty shanah, and saw his banim, and his banei banim, even arba’ah dorot.

17.verse: So Iyov died, being zaken and full of yamim.
